Comment: Exactly. Tim Cook has said this exactly. Apple will bring manufacturing here when it’s automated.  The aspect of automation that needs to be understood by everyone is if a process is fully automated said company will do it in America. This is because the engineering is here, so having the automation here just makes sense. If a process is not automated it’s likely not economically prosperous to bring it to America. These companies know it’s cheaper to just open up a new shop in a lesser tariffed nation.  All of this is why we have manufacturing where the function requires skilled labor (example: automotive assembly). Even there our workforce is no match to other nations (Korea, Japan, Germany, ets.).  It’s an extremely nuanced issue that we are trying to fix with a hammer. It’s not going make anything better it’s just going to make things different.
